html:
** PayPal Holdings Inc PYPL.O beat Street estimates for qtrly profit; co said U.S. users of its peer-to-peer payment service Venmo would be able to pay on Amazon.com AMZN.O starting next year (Full Story)

** However, co's FY 2021 revenue outlook fell short of estimates (Full Story)

** Shares down ~6% at $215.73 premarket


TIE-UP GRABS ANALYSTS' INTEREST

** Berenberg ("buy," PT: $310) says PYPL can achieve growth throughout 2022 due to ramp-up of its relationship with AMZN, launch of more functions within its Super App, and the roll-out of services such as Buy Now Pay Later (BNPL) to new regions

** "AMZN's selection of PYPL would suggest that it views PYPL’s checkout performance as superior to other companies" - Berenberg

** J.P.Morgan ("overweight," PT: $272) is optimistic that PYPL's new products and contract wins can drive growth and boost sentiment back to Q1 2021 levels

** JPM also calls the collaboration with AMZN a "breakthrough win"

** Credit Suisse ("outperform," PT: $280) says the addition of AMZN as a merchant is supportive of PYPL's potential upside to 2022 and medium-term estimates

** The relationship also opens the door for PYPL to work with AMZN in other regions and on other products such as BNPL over the longer term

** Truist Securities ("hold," PT: $200) agrees that by adding Venmo on AMZN, co is expanding its total addressable market, but says "it still lacks important physical reach"

** Cowen and Company ("outperform," PT: $268) expects PYPL to continue building more momentum on the new merchant front


(Reporting by Tapanjana Rudra)

(( Tapanjana.Rudra@thomsonreuters.com ;))
